    Join Our Lab

    Opportunities at MAILAB

    We are always looking for talented and motivated individuals to join our research team. We offer various opportunities for students and researchers at different career stages.

    PhD Program

    We are seeking talented PhD students interested in computer vision, deep learning, and multimedia analysis. As a PhD student in our lab, you will:

    • Conduct cutting-edge research in AI and computer vision
    • Publish in top-tier conferences and journals
    • Collaborate with researchers worldwide
    • Access state-of-the-art computing resources
    • Receive competitive funding and travel support
    How to Apply

    Master's Program

    Master's students in our lab gain hands-on experience with real-world AI projects while developing advanced technical skills. You will:

    • Work on research projects with practical applications
    • Learn state-of-the-art deep learning techniques
    • Develop expertise in computer vision and multimedia analysis
    • Collaborate with industry partners
    • Build a strong foundation for industry or PhD studies
    How to Apply

    Postdoctoral Positions

    We regularly have openings for postdoctoral researchers with expertise in computer vision, machine learning, or related fields. As a postdoc, you will:

    • Lead research projects aligned with your expertise
    • Mentor graduate and undergraduate students
    • Collaborate with international research partners
    • Present at prestigious conferences
    • Develop your independent research agenda
    Contact Us

    Undergraduate Research

    We welcome motivated undergraduate students interested in gaining research experience. As an undergraduate researcher, you will:

    • Work on specific components of larger research projects
    • Learn practical skills in programming and data analysis
    • Receive mentorship from graduate students and faculty
    • Prepare for graduate studies or industry positions
    • Potentially co-author research publications
    Contact Us

    Application Process

    For Prospective PhD and Master's Students

    1. Review our research: Familiarize yourself with our research areas and publications to ensure your interests align with our work.
    2. Prepare your application: Applications to our graduate programs should be submitted through the NTNU admissions portal. Required materials typically include:
      • Transcripts from previous academic institutions
      • CV/resume highlighting relevant experience
      • Statement of purpose/research interests
      • Letters of recommendation
      • English proficiency test scores (e.g., TOEFL, IELTS)
    3. Contact us: We strongly encourage prospective students to email us before applying. In your email, please include:
      • Your CV
      • Brief description of your research interests
      • Why you're interested in our lab specifically

    For Postdoctoral Applicants

    If you're interested in a postdoctoral position, please email mailab@ntnu.edu.tw with the following:

    • Your CV with publication list
    • Research statement describing your past work and future research interests
    • Contact information for 2-3 references
    • 1-2 representative publications

    For Undergraduate Students

    If you're a current NTNU undergraduate student interested in research opportunities, please email us with:

    • Your CV/resume
    • Current transcript
    • Brief description of why you're interested in our research
    • Any relevant coursework or projects

    Lab Environment & Benefits

    Resources

    Access to high-performance computing infrastructure with multiple GPUs for deep learning research

    Community

    Collaborative environment with regular seminars, reading groups, and social events

    Networking

    Opportunities to collaborate with researchers from academia and industry worldwide

    Career Development

    Mentorship and training in research, writing, presentation, and professional skills

    Our lab members have gone on to successful careers in academia and industry, including positions at leading universities, research labs, and technology companies worldwide.
